meanings.definition: A person or thing that equalizes.
meanings.sent1: The teacher acted as an equaliser in the classroom, ensuring everyone had a fair chance.
meanings.sent2: The equaliser in the group project made sure each member contributed equally.
meanings.sent3: The friendly robot served as an equaliser, making sure no one felt left out.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an equaliser, bringing balance and harmony to the team.
meanings.sent5: The mediator acted as an equaliser, resolving conflicts and promoting unity.

meanings.definition: A device used to adjust or balance sound frequencies.
meanings.sent1: The audio technician adjusted the equaliser to enhance the bass in the music.
meanings.sent2: The equaliser on the sound system helped improve the clarity of the vocals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally sat on the equaliser, creating a funny mix of sounds.
meanings.sent4: The equaliser functioned like a musical conductor, harmonizing the different tones.
meanings.sent5: With the equaliser set just right, the concert sounded perfect to the audience.

meanings.definition: A goal or point scored in a game to level the score.
meanings.sent1: The last-minute equaliser by the home team sent the crowd into a frenzy.
meanings.sent2: The striker's equaliser in the final minutes saved the team from defeat.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected equaliser from the underdog team shocked the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The equaliser was like a ray of hope, turning the tide of the game.
meanings.sent5: The dramatic equaliser brought the match to a thrilling conclusion.
